text: The Tangipahoa Parish Sheriff's Office is the principal law-enforcement agency of Tangipahoa Parish, Louisiana. It is headed by an elected sheriff, now Daniel Edwards. The office is headquartered in Hammond, Louisiana. The office maintains: * a uniformed patrol unit * a SWAT unit, called the "Special Response Team." * a police-dog unit * a mounted unit * a system of reserve deputies * the parish's jail ==Cooperation with other agencies== The Office was excluded from a DEA task force in 2016 after the Justice Department charged two deputies with stealing money and drugs seized in raids. ==References== Category:Louisiana sheriffs
title: Tangipahoa Parish Sheriff's Office (Louisiana)
